cab.content: fpumont is the property ofi. i I O i' . I S., . -.8 Mi' *V 4 tjJ - ,litary Secret. 1372From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of Slate for India,9th May 1920.(Received lOtli.) Priority A.5860. 9th May. Malleson's Mission wired 4th and 5th April :-" 1. Troops from the centre are still reaching Tashkend, among them the 3rd International Regiment, chiefly composed of Magyars. Two or three new heavy batteries are also reported." 2. Garrison pf Knsh was in middle of April 4,000 to 5,000 men with 30 to 40 guns, and has since been reduced again. Garrison of Merv at that time was 12,000 men and 6 guns." 3. Garrison of Askabad at end of April was 4,000 to 5,000 men with 17 guns." 4. Recent movements of troop trains seems to indicate some reinforcement of Askabad-Krishna line." 5. Novitsky is said to have reintroduoed saluting and badges of rank, and insists that troops live in barracks instead of billets." 6. 50,000 poods of (? corrupt group) oil reported to have arrived in Trans-Caspia from Baku in April."
